definition: legendary dragon with the ability to control rain and floods
a legendary dragon with the ability to control rain and floods/see also 蛟龍|蛟龙[jiao1 long2]

sentences.english: The earthworm mocks the dragon for neither crawling through the dirt nor living in the soil.
sentences.chinese: 蚯蚓譏笑蛟龍既不爬行於泥中也不生活在土裏。

sentences.english: They have scales like those on dragons.
Nightingales will nit sing in a cage.
sentences.chinese: 籠裏夜鶯不唱歌，浪裏蛟龍任騰越。

sentences.english: The interior of grail has dragon of 9 flood dragon, match the ground lines that comprises with briny river limit.
sentences.chinese: 大盤的內部有九條蛟龍，配以海水江涯組成的底紋。

sentences.english: Chinese officials say the Jiaolong is for civilian use only.
sentences.chinese: 中國官員說“蛟龍”號只會用於民事目的。

definition: to soar/to rise high into the air
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
to turn over/to surge/to churn/to rummage/raging (torrent)
vast and mighty (of river or ocean)/broad and powerful
(bird species of China) northern goshawk (Accipiter gentilis)
to travel/to go on a tour/to roam
(of waves) to surge forward/to roll on in waves/to gallop
to ride the wind/to use a fair wind/to take an opportunity
